acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Ellyn Polshek in 2012. The accession number associated with this gift is 2012.075.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: In 2001 and 2002, The Nation conducted a series of oral histories with individuals involved with the Alger Hiss trials. Hiss himself was interviewed by Columbia University in 1983.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection has been reboxed and foldered in archival quality housing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains an oral history Alger Hiss recorded with Edward Robb Ellis for the Columbia University Oral History Collection in 1983. The collection also includes interviews conducted by The Nation with Tim Hobson, Tillie Novick, Kenneth Simon, Ann Geismar, William A. Reuben, Gerard Piel, Lawrence Buttenwieser, Rev. Dr. Thomas Pike, Mrs. Rufus Crown, Karen Brudney, Victor Navasky, Jane Spinak and Warren Scharf, Mary Evans Collins, Janet Schane, Natalia Schiffrin, Alan Levine, Alexander Papachristou, Ronnie Chalif, and Peggy Penn. Also included are three photographs of Alger Hiss and email correspondence and contact info regarding potential interviewees for The Nation project.
